sentence.Network_en: It will be under siege, and you shall besiege it.
sentence.Network_cn: 你要对面攻击这城, 使城被困.

sentence.Network_en: It's inevitable in China that the peasants besiege the cities.
sentence.Network_cn: 农民“包围城市”,是中国现代化进程中的必然.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : alteration (by change of prefix) of assiege, from Old French asegier

entry.def: If you are besieged by people, many people want something from you and continually bother you.

example.ex: She was besieged by the press and the public.
example.tran: 她被媒体和公众纠缠不休。

entry.def: If soldiers besiege a place, they surround it and wait for the people in it to stop fighting or resisting.

example.ex: The main part of the army moved to Sevastopol to besiege the town...
example.tran: 军队主力转移到了塞瓦斯托波尔，对该城进行围攻。

example.ex: The Afghan air force was using helicopters to supply the besieged town.
example.tran: 阿富汗空军正用直升机向被围城镇提供补给。

means.word_mean: 1. surround so as to force to give up;
2. cause to feel distressed or worried;

sentences.sentence: "She was besieged by so many problems that she got discouraged"

means.word_mean: 3. harass, as with questions or requests;

sentences.sentence: "The press photographers besieged the movie star"

auth_sentence.content: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow.
auth_sentence.res_content: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow.

auth_sentence.content: I wouldn't put it past the old comrade to organise flying pickets to besiege the NUM HQ, demanding Save our perks.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I wouldn't put it past the old comrade to organise flying pickets to besiege the NUM HQ, demanding Save our perks.

means.word_mean: 包围; 围困; 围攻

sentences.en: The enemy were besieged by us.

jushi.english: He was besieged with requests for money.

jushi.chinese: 人们围住了那位歌唱家。

jushi.english: The enemy were besieged by us.
